reported in #194 - hence the test case.

issues.title: fix: Improve handling of runtime errors
issues.body: This includes for example TLS-related errors, as reported in #194 - hence the test case.

issues.title: No results in company network with TLS interception
issues.body:
In our company we have a TLS interception.
Therefore mcs can't connect to the backend as of a certificate issue.
The result is just empty result, but no error is displayed.

How can the certificate truststore can be configured?
Setting it via ```-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStrore=company-ca.jks``` seems not to work.
comments:
Hi @frimtec, thanks for reporting this!

>  The result is just empty result, but no error is displayed.

Oh, that's not nice. It should at least give you a clue as to why it didn't work.

> How can the certificate truststore can be configured?

I'll have to investigate. I distribute MCS as a native executable - it probably requires some fiddling to pass a custom truststore.

The latest [_early-access_ build](https://github.com/mthmulders/mcs/releases/tag/early-access) should have this problem addressed - at least MCS should show you what went wrong. @frimtec, could you please verify that you get a meaningful error message with that build?

Hi @mthmulders 

Thanks, now I see an error message:
```
frim@:/c/Develop/tools/mcs-0.3.2-SNAPSHOT-windows-x86_64/bin> ./mcs.exe search jpse
Searching for jpse...
java.net.ConnectException
```

Thanks for confirming, @frimtec. I've enhanced the display of the error message a bit.

For now, I will close this issue, as #199 at least ensures you'll get some kind of error message. In the meantime, I'll figure out how to work with custom trust stores - that work is tracked in #195. That will probably take a bit more time. I'll make sure to ship a release with this improvement in error handling shortly!

commit_message:
feat: Display 'plugin' for maven-plugins

Closes #236
Fixes #232

results.message:
Expecting actual:
  "
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>3.3.0</version>
    </dependency>


"
to be equal to:
  "<plugin>
    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
    <version>3.3.0</version>
</plugin>
"
when ignoring whitespace differences

issues.title: Display plugin POM element for maven-plugins
issues.body:
Closes #232

---

I initially wanted to avoid changing the interface as the rest of the `Output` classes do not use the packaging but that required more refactoring and touching the creation logic. E.g. you would have to determine the type of `POMOutput` based on the response instead of just the current `--format` flag.

I'm less familiar with the other tools, but a quick google showed me that Gradle does also have a different syntax for plugins however it uses a 'core' plugin group and a different plugin hub. Perhaps something to look into in the future. 

So I opted for placing it in the `PomXMLOutput` which IMO does make sense anyway as it is responsible for displaying the output as this is POM specific formatting.
comments: I think it makes perfect sense to only do this for **packaging = maven-plugin**. As far as I know, other build tools that support plugins (e.g. Gradle, SBT) do not declare their own packaging type. And even if they did, it's probably not `maven-plugin` :)

> And even if they did, it's probably not maven-plugin :)

Haha, fair point 🤦‍♂️. My brain either assumes every build tool is according to Maven, or it's the heat of the last couple of days ;)

In that case my idea of supporting packaging types for other build tools might not be as relevant in the other `Output` classes. Thus making the `packaging` param in the interface less usefull but it's probably not that big of an issue.
Thanks a lot for your contribution, @Giovds!

issues.title: Enhancement: Make plugins more copy friendly
issues.body:
I wanted to version lock some plugins in my `pom.xml` and I used `mcs` to search for the latest version.
After finding the latest version you get the following response:

```xml
<dependency>
   ...omitted for brevity...
</dependency>
```

Would it make sense (in most cases) for plugins to suggest the following?

```xml
<plugin>
...omitted for brevity...
</plugin>
```

The response from central [already contains](https://central.sonatype.org/search/rest-api-guide/#:~:text=Mimics%20searching%20by%20coordinate%20in%20Advanced%20Search.%20This%20search%20uses%20all%20coordinates%20(%22g%22%20for%20groupId%2C%20%22a%22%20for%20artifactId%2C%20%22v%22%20for%20version%2C%20%22p%22%20for%20packaging%2C%20%22l%22%20for%20classifier)) (or [an actual response](https://central.sonatype.com/solrsearch/select?q=maven-jar-plugin#:~:text=%22%3A%C2%A0%22-,maven%2Dplugin,-%22%2C)) a value `p` which contains the packaging type, which could be used to check if it is a `maven-plugin`.

Happy to create a PR, let me know!
comments:
Sorry for the delayed response. I like this idea a lot :-) I'd love to see a PR for this!

Please note that @hannotify and I started working on #192. I do not expect it to be finished overnight, but it may affect the way classes are constructed. If you expect you can do this change without touching much of the relations between classes, you're probably not going to be hindered anyway.

issues.title: Add latest version to wildcard searches
issues.body:
Most of the times, I'm using the tool to add a dependency to one of my projects in which case, I want the latest most of the times. Including the version in the search results by default would save me a CLI round trip:

**Before:**
```
$ mcs search okio
  Coordinates                                           Last updated
  ===========                                           ============
  org.wso2.orbit.com.squareup.okio:okio                 14 Mar 2023 at 06:48 (CET)
  com.squareup.okio:okio                                07 Jan 2023 at 23:01 (CET)
  ... More

$ mcs search com.squareup.okio:okio
Searching for com.squareup.okio:okio...
Found 65 results (showing 20)

  Coordinates                                     Last updated
  ===========                                     ============
  com.squareup.okio:okio:3.3.0                    07 Jan 2023 at 23:01 (CET)
  com.squareup.okio:okio:3.2.0                    27 Jun 2022 at 05:20 (CEST)
```

**After:**
```
$ mcs search okio
  Coordinates                                           Last updated
  ===========                                           ============
  org.wso2.orbit.com.squareup.okio:okio:2.8.0.wso2v3          14 Mar 2023 at 06:48 (CET)
  com.squareup.okio:okio:3.3.0                                                 07 Jan 2023 at 23:01 (CET)
  ... More
```
comments: Great usability improvement, thanks for the suggestion @martinbonnin!
